description: [ENA] Addis Ababa -- The regional Land, Soil and Crop Information Services project has concluded with promising results for climate-smart agriculture in Eastern Africa.
title: Africa: Project Will Yield Results for Developing Climate-Smart Agriculture in Eastern Africa - Researchers

description: [Vanguard] Nigeria's digital landscape may become under siege, if nothing is quickly done to tame the tide of cyber attacks targeting the country in particular and entire continent in general. Cyber attacks driven by financial gain, according to a new Microsoft report have surged, with 52% of incidents motivated by extortion or ransomware.
title: Africa: Cybersecurity - Microsoft Warns Africa Unprepared As Nigerian Private Sector Faces Rising Threats

description: [allAfrica] Cholera - A Political Challenge that Hits Africa Hardest
title: Africa: Cholera - A Political Challenge that Hits Africa Hardest

description: [ISS] As delays fuel public concerns, the government and ECOWAS must turn political will into action with the help of international partners.
title: Africa: Gambia's Transitional Justice Momentum Must Not Falter

description: [Daily Maverick] Conservationists are trying to pull the Congo Basin's plight out of the shadows and into the light of scientific research. Conservationist Lee White says it is Africa's beating heart and without its rainforests the continent will be in big trouble.
title: Africa: If Threatened and Ignored Congo Basin Rainforests Vanish, 'Africa Is Not Viable'

description: [Independent (Kampala)] Cairo, Egypt -- Africa's multilateral lender, African Export-Import Bank, marked the end of an era as President and Chairman of the Board, Professor Benedict Oramah, concluded his decade-long tenure with a legacy conference in Cairo attended by over 2,000 dignitaries, including African heads of state, business leaders, and policymakers on Friday.
title: Africa: Oramah Bows Out of Afreximbank As Assets Hit $44 Bn

description: [The Conversation Africa] Almost 2 million years ago, a young ancient human died beside a spring near a lake in what is now Tanzania, in eastern Africa. After archaeologists uncovered his fossilized bones in 1960, they used them to define Homo habilis - the earliest known member of our own genus.
title: Africa: AI Reveals Which Predators Chewed Ancient Humans' Bones - Challenging Ideas On Which Homo Species Was the First Tool-Using Hunter

description: [Namibian] The University of Cape Town (UCT) is spearheading a vital initiative to combat the alarming stillbirth crisis in Africa, which claims nearly one million lives annually, primarily from preventable causes.
title: Africa: UCT Tackles Africa's Stilbirth Crisis

description: [WFP] Rome -- The United Nations World Food Programme (WFP) confirms that the Sudanese Ministry of Foreign Affairs has informed us that two of our top leaders in Sudan have been designated as persona non grata, and asked to leave the country within 72 hours, without any explanation. This decision to expel WFP's Country Director and Emergency Coordinator comes at a pivotal time. Humanitarian needs in Sudan have never been greater with more than 24 million people facing acute food insecurity and communities impacted by
title: Africa: WFP Statement Regarding Staff Expulsions By Sudanese Ministry of Foreign Affairs

description: [SAnews.gov.za] As the first African nation to host the G20 Summit, South Africa assumes this historic role with honour and unwavering commitment to amplify the voices of the Global South on the world stage.
title: Africa: South Africa Advocates for a Digitally Inclusive Future Through Its G20 Presidency

description: [The Conversation Africa] Every year humanity produces nearly 300 million tonnes of plastic. Only a fraction ever gets recycled. Most ends up in rivers, oceans and soil, slowly breaking down into tiny, invisible microplastics that get into what we eat and drink.
title: Africa: Ecoball - How to Turn Picking Up Litter Into a Game for Kids

description: [Daily Maverick] South Africa is pursuing an ambitious G20 agenda for the November Summit in Johannesburg -- an agenda which, say some, is overly ambitious.
title: Africa: SA's G20 Agenda Draws Broad Support - - but It Could Be Undone By Trump's Opposition

description: [Premium Times] Mr Saraki observed that more than six decades after independence, Africa's project of full sovereignty--economic, political, and intellectual--remains incomplete.
title: Africa: Saraki Calls for African Renaissance, Urges End to Dependency At Nairobi Forum
